title: Drawing, "The Royal Pavilion, Brighton, Blue (South) Drawing Room, Proposed Wall Decoration", ca. 1820
markings: Stamp: Cooper Union Museum stamp on verso.
inscribed: In graphite, lower center (according to the Crace portfolios, in George IV's hand): Gallery next the dining toom color yellow/pannel to be raised and a dado the same as the other gallery.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Horizontal rectangle.  The central panel is composed of the painted representation of drapery suspended above by three birds, the drapery itself having a design of Chinese flowers.  The two narrow panels which flank it have designs of elephants and Chinese flowers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Royal Pavilion, Brighton, Blue (South) Drawing Room, Proposed Wall Decoration", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-32.
